thread.title: Sunday Standouts: A look at the week’s best performers
thread.title_full: Sunday Standouts: A look at the week’s best performers | Boston Herald

author: Herald Staff
title: Sunday Standouts: A look at the week’s best performers
text:
1. Josh McCown, Browns 36-for-51, 457 yds, 2 TDs, 1 rush TD in 33-30 OT win over Ravens.
35 pts
2. Blake Bortles, Jaguars 23-for-33, 303 yds, 4 TDs, in 38-31 loss to the Buccaneers.
28 pts
3. Andy Dalton 30-for-44, 331 yds, 2 TDs in 27-24 OT win over Seahawks.
26 pts
1. Doug Martin, Buccaneers 123 yds rush, 2 TD; 3 rec., 35 yds, TD in 38-31 win over Jags.
33 pts
2. Devonta Freeman, Falcons 153 yds, TD; 7 rec., 44 yds. in 25-19 win over Redskins.
25 pts
3. Thomas Rawls, Seahawks 169 yds, TD in 27-24 OT loss to Bengals.
22 pts
1. Tyler Eifert, Bengals 8 rec., 90 yds, 2 TDs in 27-24 OT win over Seahawks.
21 pts
2. Andre Johnson, Colts 6 rec. for 77 yds, 2 TD in 27-20 win over Texans.
19 pts
3. Allen Robinson, Jaguars 7 rec. for 72 yds, 2 TD in 38-31 loss to Buccaneers.
19 pts
L Chiefs RB Jamaal Charles Knee
L Rams DE Chris Long Knee
L Saints WR Marques Colston Shoulder
L Browns CB Joe Haden Concussion
L Broncos DL DeMarcus Ware Back
Players you’ll want to add to your team:
1. Chiefs RB Knile Davis Charles’ injury did not look good, and Davis may be the guy for KC going forward. He is only owned in 23.9% of leagues.
2. Ravens WR Kamar Aiken He seems to be the go-to guy in Baltimore now that Steve Smith Sr. is out, and he’s still available in just under 32% of leagues.
3. Jaguars WR Allen Hurns Owned in under half of leagues, Hurns has had at least 100 yards and a touchdown in the past two games.
